records.articleTitle: Robust and Uncertainty-Aware VAE (RU-VAE) for One-Class Classification
records.highlightedTitle: Robust and Uncertainty-Aware VAE (RU-VAE) for One-Class Classification
records.publicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.displayPublicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.abstract: One-class classification (OCC) methods for abnormality detection learn either a generative model of the inlier class (e.g., using variants of kernel principal component analysis) or a decision boundary to encapsulate the inlier class (e.g., using one-class variants of the support vector machine). Recent methods use deep-neural-network models to learn (for the inlier class) either latent-space dist...

records.articleTitle: Deep Neural Network for 3D Particle Detection in 3D Fluorescence Microscopy Images via Density Map Regression
records.highlightedTitle: Deep Neural Network for 3D Particle Detection in 3D Fluorescence Microscopy Images via Density Map Regression
records.publicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.displayPublicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.abstract: Automatic detection of particles in fluorescence microscopy images is crucial to analyze cellular processes. We introduce a novel deep learning method for 3D fluorescent particle detection. Instead of pixel-wise binary classification or direct coordinate regression, we perform image-to-image mapping based on regressing a density map. Detections close to particles are rewarded in the network traini...

records.articleTitle: Deep Neural Network for Combined Particle Tracking and Colocalization Analysis in Two-Channel Microscopy Images
records.highlightedTitle: Deep Neural Network for Combined Particle Tracking and Colocalization Analysis in Two-Channel Microscopy Images
records.publicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.displayPublicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.abstract: Analyzing protein dynamics in multi-channel fluorescence microscopy data is important to understand biological processes. We present a novel deep learning approach for combined particle tracking and colocalization analysis in two-channel microscopy image sequences. The approach is based on a convolutional long short-term memory network and exploits colocalization information to improve tracking. S...

records.articleTitle: Predicting Knee Osteoarthritis Progression from Structural MRI Using Deep Learning
records.highlightedTitle: Predicting Knee Osteoarthritis Progression from Structural MRI Using Deep Learning
records.publicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.displayPublicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.abstract: Accurate prediction of knee osteoarthritis (KOA) progression from structural MRI has a potential to enhance disease understanding and support clinical trials. Prior art focused on manually designed imaging biomarkers, which may not fully exploit all disease-related information present in MRI scan. In contrast, our method learns relevant representations from raw data end-to-end using Deep Learning,...

records.articleTitle: Unsupervised Domain Adaptation for Cross-Modality Retinal Vessel Segmentation via Disentangling Representation Style Transfer and Collaborative Consistency Learning
records.highlightedTitle: Unsupervised Domain Adaptation for Cross-Modality Retinal Vessel Segmentation via Disentangling Representation Style Transfer and Collaborative Consistency Learning
records.publicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.displayPublicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.abstract: Various deep learning models have been developed to segment anatomical structures from medical images, but they typically have poor performance when tested on another target domain with different data distribution. Recently, unsupervised domain adaptation methods have been proposed to alleviate this so-called domain shift issue, but most of them are designed for scenarios with relatively small dom...

records.articleTitle: Deep Semi-Supervised Metric Learning with Dual Alignment for Cervical Cancer Cell Detection
records.highlightedTitle: Deep Semi-Supervised Metric Learning with Dual Alignment for Cervical Cancer Cell Detection
records.publicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.displayPublicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.abstract: Deep learning has achieved unprecedented success in various object detection tasks with huge amounts of labeled data. However, obtaining large-scale annotations for medical images is extremely challenging due to the high demand of labour and expertise. In this paper, we propose a novel deep semi-supervised metric learning method to effectively leverage both labeled and unlabeled data for cervical ...

records.articleTitle: A Hybrid Multi-Object Segmentation Framework with Model-Based B-Splines for Microbial Single Cell Analysis
records.highlightedTitle: A Hybrid Multi-Object Segmentation Framework with Model-Based B-Splines for Microbial Single Cell Analysis
records.publicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.displayPublicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.abstract: In this paper, we propose a hybrid approach for multi-object microbial cell segmentation. The approach combines an ML-based detection with a geometry-aware variational-based segmentation using B-splines that are parametrized based on a geometric model of the cell shape. The detection is done first using YOLOv5. In a second step, each detected cell is segmented individually. Thus, the segmentation ...

records.articleTitle: Location-Guided Coarse-to-Fine Network for Whole Heart Segmentation
records.highlightedTitle: Location-Guided Coarse-to-Fine Network for Whole Heart Segmentation
records.publicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.displayPublicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.abstract: The human heart is a hollow muscular organ with very large variations in shape and size, automatic and accurate segmentation of the whole heart is challenging for medical image analysis. To tackle this challenge, a simple and effective fully automatic coarse-to-fine network is proposed to enable whole heart segmentation. It comprehensively captures the anatomical dependencies of the heart and its ...

records.articleTitle: Semi-Supervised Deep Expectation-Maximization for Low-Dose Pet-Ct
records.highlightedTitle: Semi-Supervised Deep Expectation-Maximization for Low-Dose Pet-Ct
records.publicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.displayPublicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.abstract: Reducing the dose of ionizing radiation underlying combined imaging with positron emission tomography (PET) and computed tomography (CT) typically leads to reduced image quality. We propose a novel variational deep-neural-network (DNN) framework for image quality enhancement of low-dose PET-CT images, relying on Monte-Carlo expectation maximization. Unlike existing DNN-based training that pairs lo...

records.articleTitle: Automated Measurements of Mitral and Tricuspid Annular Dimensions in Cardiovascular Magnetic Resonance
records.highlightedTitle: Automated Measurements of Mitral and Tricuspid Annular Dimensions in Cardiovascular Magnetic Resonance
records.publicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.displayPublicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.abstract: Our recent work on mitral and tricuspid valve tracking in cardiovascular magnetic resonance (CMR) imaging to obtain accurate evaluations of longitudinal myocardial valve motion (both relaxation and contraction) has enabled an automated diastolic function assessment (e’) with CMR. Its time-resolved capability allows a further evaluation of the valve dynamics by providing valve dimension measurement...

records.articleTitle: EG-Trans3DUNet: A Single-Staged Transformer-Based Model for Accurate Vertebrae Segmentation from Spinal Ct Images
records.highlightedTitle: EG-Trans3DUNet: A Single-Staged Transformer-Based Model for Accurate Vertebrae Segmentation from Spinal Ct Images
records.publicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.displayPublicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.abstract: Multi-label vertebrae segmentation has been a fundamental research for spinal image analysis and surgical intervention. However, most existing methods have some drawbacks including poor boundary segmentation results and identification of the 25th vertebra. In this paper, we propose a single-staged network based on vision Transformer and UNet. Besides, we exert supervision on vertebrae Edges and in...

records.articleTitle: Improving the Automatic Segmentation of Elongated Organs Using Geometrical Priors
records.highlightedTitle: Improving the Automatic Segmentation of Elongated Organs Using Geometrical Priors
records.publicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.displayPublicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.abstract: Deep neural networks are widely used for automated organ segmentation as they achieve promising results for clinical applications. Some organs are more challenging to delineate than others, for instance due to low contrast at their boundaries. In this paper, we propose to improve the segmentation of elongated organs thanks to Geometrical Priors that can be introduced during training, using a local...

records.articleTitle: Weakly Supervised Nuclei Segmentation Via Instance Learning
records.highlightedTitle: Weakly Supervised Nuclei Segmentation Via Instance Learning
records.publicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.displayPublicationTitle: 2022 IEEE 19th International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging (ISBI)
records.abstract: Weakly supervised nuclei segmentation is a critical problem for pathological image analysis and greatly benefits the community due to the significant reduction of labeling cost. Adopting point annotations, previous methods mostly rely on less expressive representations for nuclei instances and thus have difficulty in handling crowded nuclei. In this paper, we propose to decouple weakly supervised ...
